tools.name: postgres-pg_analyze_database
tools.description: Analyze PostgreSQL database configuration and performance

connectionString.description: PostgreSQL connection string (optional if POSTGRES_CONNECTION_STRING environment variable or --connection-string CLI option is set)

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_functions
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL functions - get, create, or drop functions with a single tool. Examples: operation="get" to list functions, operation="create" with functionName="test_func", parameters="" (empty for no params), returnType="TEXT", functionBody="SELECT 'Hello'"

operation.description: Operation to perform: get (list/info), create (new function), or drop (remove function)

functionName.description: Name of the function (required for create/drop, optional for get to filter)

parameters.description: Function parameters - required for create operation, required for drop when function is overloaded. Use empty string "" for functions with no parameters

returnType.description: Return type of the function (required for create operation)

functionBody.description: Function body code (required for create operation)

language.description: Function language (defaults to plpgsql for create)

volatility.description: Function volatility (defaults to VOLATILE for create)

security.description: Function security context (defaults to INVOKER for create)

replace.description: Whether to replace the function if it exists (for create operation)

ifExists.description: Whether to include IF EXISTS clause (for drop operation)

cascade.description: Whether to include CASCADE clause (for drop operation)

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_rls
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL Row-Level Security - enable/disable RLS and manage policies. Examples: operation="enable" with tableName="users", operation="create_policy" with tableName, policyName, using, check

operation.description: Operation: enable/disable RLS, create_policy, edit_policy, drop_policy, get_policies

tableName.description: Table name (required for enable/disable/create_policy/edit_policy/drop_policy, optional filter for get_policies)

using.description: USING expression for policy (required for create_policy, optional for edit_policy)

check.description: WITH CHECK expression for policy (optional for create_policy/edit_policy)

command.description: Command the policy applies to (for create_policy)

role.description: Role the policy applies to (for create_policy)

replace.description: Whether to replace policy if exists (for create_policy)

roles.description: List of roles for policy (for edit_policy)

tools.name: postgres-pg_debug_database
tools.description: Debug common PostgreSQL issues

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_schema
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL schema - get schema info, create/alter tables, manage enums. Examples: operation="get_info" for table lists, operation="create_table" with tableName and columns, operation="get_enums" to list enums, operation="create_enum" with enumName and values

operation.description: Operation: get_info (schema/table info), create_table (new table), alter_table (modify table), get_enums (list ENUMs), create_enum (new ENUM)

tableName.description: Table name (optional for get_info to get specific table info, required for create_table/alter_table)

nullable.description: Whether the column can be NULL (for add/alter)

enumName.description: ENUM name (optional for get_enums to filter, required for create_enum)

ifNotExists.description: Include IF NOT EXISTS clause (for create_enum)

tools.name: postgres-pg_export_table_data
tools.description: Export table data to JSON or CSV format

outputPath.description: absolute path to save the exported data

tools.name: postgres-pg_import_table_data
tools.description: Import data from JSON or CSV file into a table

inputPath.description: absolute path to the file to import

tools.name: postgres-pg_copy_between_databases
tools.description: Copy data between two databases

tools.name: postgres-pg_monitor_database
tools.description: Get real-time monitoring information for a PostgreSQL database

tools.name: postgres-pg_get_setup_instructions
tools.description: Get step-by-step PostgreSQL setup instructions

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_triggers
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL triggers - get, create, drop, and enable/disable triggers. Examples: operation="get" to list triggers, operation="create" with triggerName, tableName, functionName, operation="drop" with triggerName and tableName, operation="set_state" with triggerName, tableName, enable

operation.description: Operation: get (list triggers), create (new trigger), drop (remove trigger), set_state (enable/disable trigger)

tableName.description: Table name (optional filter for get, required for create/drop/set_state)

timing.description: Trigger timing (for create operation, defaults to AFTER)

events.description: Trigger events (for create operation, defaults to ["INSERT"])

forEach.description: FOR EACH ROW or STATEMENT (for create operation, defaults to ROW)

replace.description: Whether to replace trigger if exists (for create operation)

ifExists.description: Include IF EXISTS clause (for drop operation)

enable.description: Whether to enable the trigger (required for set_state operation)

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_indexes
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL indexes - get, create, drop, reindex, and analyze usage with a single tool. Examples: operation="get" to list indexes, operation="create" with indexName, tableName, columns, operation="analyze_usage" for performance analysis

operation.description: Operation: get (list indexes), create (new index), drop (remove index), reindex (rebuild), analyze_usage (find unused/duplicate)

tableName.description: Table name (optional for get/analyze_usage, required for create)

columns.description: Column names for the index (required for create operation)

method.description: Index method (for create operation, defaults to btree)

where.description: WHERE clause for partial index (for create operation)

ifNotExists.description: Include IF NOT EXISTS clause (for create operation)

ifExists.description: Include IF EXISTS clause (for drop operation)

target.description: Target name for reindex (required for reindex operation)

type.description: Type of target for reindex (required for reindex operation)

minSizeBytes.description: Minimum index size in bytes (for analyze_usage operation)

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_query
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL query analysis and performance - operation="explain" for EXPLAIN plans, operation="get_slow_queries" for slow query analysis, operation="get_stats" for query statistics, operation="reset_stats" for clearing statistics

operation.description: Operation: explain (EXPLAIN/EXPLAIN ANALYZE query), get_slow_queries (find slow queries from pg_stat_statements), get_stats (query statistics with cache hit ratios), reset_stats (reset pg_stat_statements)

query.description: SQL query to explain (required for explain operation)

analyze.description: Use EXPLAIN ANALYZE - actually executes the query (for explain operation)

buffers.description: Include buffer usage information (for explain operation)

limit.description: Number of slow queries to return (for get_slow_queries operation)

minDuration.description: Minimum average duration in milliseconds (for get_slow_queries operation)

orderBy.description: Sort order (for get_slow_queries and get_stats operations)

includeNormalized.description: Include normalized query text (for get_slow_queries operation)

minCalls.description: Minimum number of calls (for get_stats operation)

queryPattern.description: Filter queries containing this pattern (for get_stats operation)

queryId.description: Specific query ID to reset (for reset_stats operation, resets all if not provided)

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_users
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL users and permissions - create, drop, alter users, grant/revoke permissions. Examples: operation="create" with username="testuser", operation="grant" with username, permissions, target, targetType

operation.description: Operation: create (new user), drop (remove user), alter (modify user), grant (permissions), revoke (permissions), get_permissions (view permissions), list (all users)

username.description: Username (required for create/drop/alter/grant/revoke/get_permissions, optional filter for list)

password.description: Password for the user (for create operation)

createdb.description: Allow user to create databases (for create/alter operations)

createrole.description: Allow user to create roles (for create/alter operations)

login.description: Allow user to login (for create/alter operations)

connectionLimit.description: Maximum number of connections (for create/alter operations)

validUntil.description: Password expiration date YYYY-MM-DD (for create/alter operations)

inherit.description: Inherit privileges from parent roles (for create/alter operations)

ifExists.description: Include IF EXISTS clause (for drop operation)

cascade.description: Include CASCADE to drop owned objects (for drop/revoke operations)

targetType.description: Type of target object (for grant/revoke operations)

withGrantOption.description: Allow user to grant these permissions to others (for grant operation)

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_constraints
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL constraints - get, create foreign keys, drop foreign keys, create constraints, drop constraints. Examples: operation="get" to list constraints, operation="create_fk" with constraintName, tableName, columnNames, referencedTable, referencedColumns

operation.description: Operation: get (list constraints), create_fk (foreign key), drop_fk (drop foreign key), create (constraint), drop (constraint)

tableName.description: Table name (optional filter for get, required for create_fk/drop_fk/create/drop)

constraintType.description: Filter by constraint type (for get operation)

columnNames.description: Column names in the table (required for create_fk)

referencedSchema.description: Referenced table schema (for create_fk, defaults to same as table schema)

constraintTypeCreate.description: Type of constraint to create (for create operation)

checkExpression.description: Check expression (for create operation with check constraints)

ifExists.description: Include IF EXISTS clause (for drop_fk/drop operations)

tools.name: postgres-pg_execute_query
tools.description: Execute SELECT queries and data retrieval operations - operation="select/count/exists" with query and optional parameters. Examples: operation="select", query="SELECT * FROM users WHERE created_at > $1", parameters=["2024-01-01"]

operation.description: Query operation: select (fetch rows), count (count rows), exists (check existence)

parameters.description: Parameter values for prepared statement placeholders ($1, $2, etc.)

limit.description: Maximum number of rows to return (safety limit)

tools.name: postgres-pg_execute_mutation
tools.description: Execute data modification operations (INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE/UPSERT) - operation="insert/update/delete/upsert" with table and data. Examples: operation="insert", table="users", data={"name":"John","email":"john@example.com"}

operation.description: Mutation operation: insert (add rows), update (modify rows), delete (remove rows), upsert (insert or update)

data.description: Data object with column-value pairs (required for insert/update/upsert)

where.description: WHERE clause for update/delete operations (without WHERE keyword)

conflictColumns.description: Columns for conflict resolution in upsert (ON CONFLICT)

returning.description: RETURNING clause to get back inserted/updated data

tools.name: postgres-pg_execute_sql
tools.description: Execute arbitrary SQL statements - sql="ANY_VALID_SQL" with optional parameters and transaction support. Examples: sql="CREATE INDEX ...", sql="WITH complex_cte AS (...) SELECT ...", transactional=true

sql.description: SQL statement to execute (can be any valid PostgreSQL SQL)

parameters.description: Parameter values for prepared statement placeholders ($1, $2, etc.)

expectRows.description: Whether to expect rows back (false for statements like CREATE, DROP, etc.)

transactional.description: Whether to wrap in a transaction

tools.name: postgres-pg_manage_comments
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL object comments - get, set, remove comments on tables, columns, functions, and other database objects. Examples: operation="get" with objectType="table", objectName="users", operation="set" with comment text, operation="bulk_get" for discovery

operation.description: Operation: get (retrieve comments), set (add/update comment), remove (delete comment), bulk_get (discovery mode)

objectType.description: Type of database object (required for get/set/remove)

objectName.description: Name of the object (required for get/set/remove)

schema.description: Schema name (defaults to public, required for most object types)

includeSystemObjects.description: Include system objects in bulk_get (defaults to false)

filterObjectType.description: Filter by object type in bulk_get operation

tools.name: filesystem-read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file as text. DEPRECATED: Use read_text_file instead.

tail.description: If provided, returns only the last N lines of the file

head.description: If provided, returns only the first N lines of the file

tools.name: filesystem-read_text_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system as text. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Use the 'head' parameter to read only the first N lines of a file, or the 'tail' parameter to read only the last N lines of a file. Operates on the file as text regardless of extension. Only works within allowed directories.

tail.description: If provided, returns only the last N lines of the file

head.description: If provided, returns only the first N lines of the file

tools.name: filesystem-read_media_file
tools.description: Read an image or audio file. Returns the base64 encoded data and MIME type. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: filesystem-create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-list_directory_with_sizes
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path, including sizes. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is useful for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

sortBy.description: Sort entries by name or size

tools.name: filesystem-directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem-list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Subdirectories within these allowed directories are also accessible. Use this to understand which directories and their nested paths are available before trying to access files.
